rdf:Description.rdfs:label: MediaType
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment:
Represent the label (estructured into trees) used to identify the content type os a particular protocols, including but not limited to HTTP [RFC2616] and MIME [RFC2045], which are capable of carrying arbitrary labeled content. (Definicion adapted from https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6838).
The location of the media type registry is http://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: is described by
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Relation from a thing to its thing descriptions

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Communication protocol
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A protocol is an agreement between the communicating parties on how communication is to proceed. (Definition taken from "Tanenbaum, A. S. (2003). Computer networks, 4-th edition. ed: Prentice Hall.")

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: provides interaction pattern
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Link from a thing to the interaction patterns it provides

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has output data
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: link to the n-ary class that allows the declaration of the data type and unit of measure provided by an interaction pattern.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: is measured in
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A relation between a measurement and the unit of measure in which the measurement value is expressed.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: thing name
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Name of a thing

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has input data
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: link to the n-ary class that allows the declaration of the data type and unit of measure expected by an interaction pattern.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has media type
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: link to the media types sopported by an endpoint

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Event
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The Event interaction pattern enables a mechanism to be notified by a Thing on a certain condition. (Description taken from http://w3c.github.io/wot/current-practices/wot-practices#event)

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: base URI
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Define base URI that is valid for all defined local interaction resources. All other URIs in the TD must then be resolved using the algorithm defined in [RFC3986]. This field is optional. (Definition taken from http://w3c.github.io/wot/current-practices/wot-practices#thing-metadata)

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: is provided over protocol
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Relates an endpoint with the communication protocol it is served over. A given endpoint can be provided over at most one protocol.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: name
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: General attribute for names assigned to any type of concept

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: is required
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Boolean value that indicates whether a property is required to be present.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Service
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A service is a representation of a function to a network that makes the function discoverable, registerable, remotely controllable by other devices in the network. A service can represent one or more functions. A Service is offered by a device that wants (a certain set of) its function(s) to be discoverable, registerable, remotely controllable by other devices in the network. A Service must specify the device that is offering the service, the function(s) to be represented, and the (input and output) parameters necessary to operate the service.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Action
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The Action interaction pattern targets changes or processes on a Thing that take a certain time to complete (i.e., actions cannot be applied instantaneously like property writes). Examples include an LED fade in, moving a robot, brewing a cup of coffee, etc. Usually, ongoing Actions are modelled as Task resources, which are created when an Action invocation is received by the Thing. (Definition taken from http://w3c.github.io/wot/current-practices/wot-practices#action)

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Interaction pattern
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An interaction in the context of the Web of Things is an exchange of data between a Web client and a Thing. This data can be either given as input by the client, returned as output by the Thing or both. Three interaction patterns have been defined so far: Property, Action and Event. (Definition taken from http://w3c.github.io/wot/current-practices/wot-practices#interaction-patterns)

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: is accessible through
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Indicates the endpoints from which an interaction pattern is accessible

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Data format
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: N-ary class defined to allow the representation of pairs (data type, unit of measure) that are expected as input data or output data of a given interaction pattern.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: href
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: URI of the endpoint where an interaction pattern is provided

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: is writable
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Boolean value that indicates whether a property is writable

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: describes thing
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Link from a thing description to the thing being described

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Thing
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The abstract concept of a physical entity that can either be a real-world artifact, such as a device, or a virtual entity that represents physicality, such as a room or group of devices

An thing is anything (both physical and non-physical) which has a distinct and independent existence. Every thing has a unique identity. (Definition adapted from ISO/IEC CC 30141. Information technology - Internet of Things Reference architecutre (IoT RA))

rdf:Description.vs:term_status: unstable. where does this req come from?
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: defaultValue
Web of Thing interface
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Resource-oriented Web interface (often called "Web API") that allows access to servients over the network using different Protocol Bindings.
A WoT interface is also a web API that follows the recommendations of the WoT Interest Group.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Ontology model for Web of Things
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: This ontology aims to model the Web of Things domain according to the w3c Interest Group (http://w3c.github.io/wot/)

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Data type
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Set of distinct values, characterized by properties of those values, and by operations on those values (definition taken from ISO/IEC 11404:2007)

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: interaction name
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Name of an interaction pattern

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has value type
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Link to the data type used for the values provided following a given data format

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Property
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Property provides readable and/or writeable data that can be static (e.g., supported mode, rated output voltage, etc.) or dynamic (e.g., current fill level of water, minimum recorded temperature, etc.). (Definition taken from http://w3c.github.io/wot/current-practices/wot-practices#property)

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Endpoint
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A URL where a service can be accessed by a client application. A service might have more than one endpoint.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Unit of measure
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The unit of measure is a standard for measurement of a quantity, such as a Property. For example, Temperature is a property and centigrade (or Celsius) is a unit of temperature that represents a definite predetermined temperature: when we say 20 centigrade, we actually mean 20 times the definite predetermined temperature unit called "centigrade". Our definition is based on the definition of unit of measure in the Ontology of units of Measure (OM). (Definition adapted from SAREF ontology)
